alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan; Coal; Hughes; Johnston (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 3:39PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Johnston, northwestern Bryan, Coal, western Atoka and southeastern Hughes Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 339 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Gerty to 4 miles west of Atoka to 5 miles north of Caddo to 3 miles south of Durant. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Durant, Atoka, Coalgate, Colbert, Caddo, Wapanucka, Stringtown, Lehigh, Silo, Tupelo, Tushka, Caney, Kenefic, Stuart, Mead, Gerty, Armstrong, Centrahoma, Clarita, and Olney. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
